column1: Erellont was one of the three mariners who accompanied Eärendil and Elwing to Aman
column2: the other two being Aerandir and Falathar.

column1: J.R.R. Tolkien never specified the race of the three mariners: while it has been suggested that they were Men
column2: http://www.glyphweb.com/arda/a/aerandir.html Aerandir at http://www.glyphweb.com/arda/default.asp Encyclopedia of Arda (accessed 6 April 2011) others argue that they were Elves.http://www.twcenter.net/forums/showthread.php?t=347256&page=73 War of the Silmarils (game forum thread; accessed 6 April 2011)

column1: The meaning of Erellont is unknown. It has been speculated that the name means "lonely (star) ship" in Sindarin
column2: In that case derived from ereb (+ êl) + a possible derivative of LUT. or that the name is "possibly a dialectal Sindarin of the Falas" or even a "combination of Mannish and Elvish".http://groups.yahoo.com/group/elfling/message/26202 Erellont - name etymology (message 26202; August 2
